HistoryItems.ToValue: New integration: Import Manufacturing Specification from Castor
This issue is required for OFU-2234

HistoryItems.FromValue: New integration: Import Manufacturing Specification from Castor
HistoryItems.ToValue: New integration: Import OrderedProductSpecification from Castor

As a merchandiser working with preproduction
I want to see the status of the Order Package in the order Status list
So that I will know if the order is ready for production or if I will need to act


*Scenario 1:OrderedProductSpecification: No Order Package*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification no OrderSpecificationPackage
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
Then the Order Package status is set to "Not Sent"

*Scenario 2:OrderedProductSpecification: Import the Order Package info*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification includes at least one OrderSpecificationPackage
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
Then the SentDate, Notes and the status is imported for each OrderSpecificationPackage

*Scenario 3:OrderedProductSpecification: Set Order Package Status*
GIVEN Scenario 2
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
AND the Status of the OrderSpecificationPackage with the latest SentDate is NOT "Confirmed"
Then the Order Package status is set to "Sent"

*Scenario 4:OrderedProductSpecification: Set Order Package Status*
GIVEN Scenario 2
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
AND the Status of the OrderSpecificationPackage with the latest SentDate is "Confirmed"
Then the Order Package status is set to "Confirmed"

*Scenario 2: OrderedProductSpecification: Import the Order Package info*

HistoryItems.ToValue:
As a merchandiser working with preproduction
I want to see the status of the Order Package in the order Status list
So that I will know if the order is ready for production or if I will need to act


*Scenario 1: OrderedProductSpecification:  Set Order Package Status "Not Sent"*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification no OrderSpecificationPackage
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
Then the Order Package status is set to "Not Sent"

*Scenario 2: OrderedProductSpecification: Import the Order Package info*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification includes at least one OrderSpecificationPackage
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
Then the SentDate, Notes and the status is imported for each OrderSpecificationPackage

*Scenario 3: OrderedProductSpecification: Set Order Package Status "Sent"*
GIVEN Scenario 2
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
AND the Status of the OrderSpecificationPackage with the latest SentDate is NOT "Confirmed"
Then the Order Package status is set to "Sent"

*Scenario 4: OrderedProductSpecification: Set Order Package Status "Confirmed"*
GIVEN Scenario 2
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
AND the Status of the OrderSpecificationPackage with the latest SentDate is "Confirmed"
Then the Order Package status is set to "Confirmed"


*Technical information*
DevelopmentOptionSerieId in OrderedProductSpecification is equivalent to ManufacturingOptionId in current ManufacturingSpecification import
all data that we take in from ManufacturingSpecification should exist in OrderProductSpecification. We are not interested in data we not already store.

HistoryItems.ToValue:
As a merchandiser working with preproduction
I want to see the status of the Order Package in the order Status list
So that I will know if the order is ready for production or if I will need to act

Default value "Not Sent"

*Scenario 1: OrderedProductSpecification:  Set Order Package Status "Not Sent"*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification has no OrderSpecificationPackage
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
Then the Order Package status is set to "Not Sent"

*Scenario 2: OrderedProductSpecification: Import the Order Package info*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification includes at least one OrderSpecificationPackage
When the OrderedProductSpecification information is imported
Then the latest SentDate of the OrderSpecificationPackages of the import is saved as the Order Package timestamp

*Scenario 3: OrderedProductSpecification: Set Order Package Status "Sent"*
GIVEN Scenario 2
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
Then the Order Package status is set to "Sent"


*Technical information*
DevelopmentOptionSerieId in OrderedProductSpecification is equivalent to ManufacturingOptionId in current ManufacturingSpecification import

all data that we take in from ManufacturingSpecification should exist in OrderProductSpecification. We are not interested in data we not already store.

Use glossaryexpressionid for placement and position.
This issue is required for OFU-2373

HistoryItems.FromValue: New integration: Import OrderedProductSpecification from Castor

So that I will know if the order is ready for production or if I will need to act

Default value "Not Sent"

*Scenario 1: OrderedProductSpecification:  Set Order Package Status "Not Sent"*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification has no OrderSpecificationPackage
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
Then the Order Package status is set to "Not Sent"

*Scenario 2: OrderedProductSpecification: Import the Order Package info*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification includes at least one OrderSpecificationPackage
When the OrderedProductSpecification information is imported
Then the latest SentDate of the OrderSpecificationPackages of the import is saved as the Order Package timestamp

*Scenario 3: OrderedProductSpecification: Set Order Package Status "Sent"*
GIVEN Scenario 2
When the OrderedProductSpecification is imported
Then the Order Package status is set to "Sent"


*Technical information*
DevelopmentOptionSerieId in OrderedProductSpecification is equivalent to ManufacturingOptionId in current ManufacturingSpecification import

all data that we take in from ManufacturingSpecification should exist in OrderProductSpecification. We are not interested in data we not already store.

Use glossaryexpressionid for placement and position.
HistoryItems.ToValue:
As a merchandiser working with preproduction
I want to see the status of the Order Package in the order Status list
So that I will know if the order is ready for production or if I will need to act

Default value "Not Sent"

*Scenario 1: OrderedProductSpecification: Order Package timestamp not set*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification includes at least one OrderSpecificationPackage
AND that the Order Package timestamp (in OFU) is not set
When the OrderedProductSpecification information is imported
Then the latest SentDate of the OrderSpecificationPackages of the import is saved as the Order Package timestamp
AND the Order Package status is set to "Sent"

*Scenario 2: OrderedProductSpecification: Order Package timestamp is set*
GIVEN that an OrderedProductSpecification is imported for an order
AND that the OrderedProductSpecification includes at least one OrderSpecificationPackage
AND that the Order Package timestamp (in OFU) is set
AND that the latest SentDate of the OrderSpecificationPackages of the import is later than the Order Package timestamp
When the OrderedProductSpecification information is imported
Then the latest SentDate of the OrderSpecificationPackages of the import is saved as the Order Package timestamp
AND the Order Package status is set to "Sent"


*Technical information*
DevelopmentOptionSerieId in OrderedProductSpecification is equivalent to ManufacturingOptionId in current ManufacturingSpecification import

all data that we take in from ManufacturingSpecification should exist in OrderProductSpecification. We are not interested in data we not already store.

Use glossaryexpressionid for placement and position.

HistoryItems.FromValue:
*Requirement*
- Currently there are one "From" and "To" fields for each date type (OPD, TOD, ISW) in the filter. Change it to be only one for all date types according to the attached image.
- By default "All dates" is selected and the "From" and "To" dates shall be empty and disabled.
- User shall be able to filter on OPD, TOD or ISW by selecting one of them by clicking in the radio button.
- When clicking in the radio button for OPD, TOD or ISW the "From" and "To" fields shall be enabled and possible to edit.
- No new filtering on date will be done until user picks a date in either the "From" or "To" fields.
- If user has filtered on for instance OPD and the changes to TOD the dates entered previously shall be applied until new dates are entered in the "From" and/or "To" fields.
HistoryItems.ToValue:
*Requirement*
- Currently there are one "From" and "To" fields for each date type (OPD, TOD, ISW) in the filter. Change it to be only one for all date types according to the attached image.
- By default "All dates" is selected and the "From" and "To" dates shall be empty and disabled.
- User shall be able to filter on OPD, TOD or ISW by selecting one of them by clicking in the radio button.
- When clicking in the radio button for OPD, TOD or ISW the "From" and "To" fields shall be enabled and possible to edit.
- No new filtering on date will be done until user picks a date in either the "From" or "To" fields.
- If user has filtered on for instance OPD and then changes to TOD/ISW the dates entered previously shall be applied until new dates are entered in the "From" and/or "To" fields.
This issue is implemented by OFU-1273
This issue is related to OFU-683

HistoryItems.FromValue:
As an order follow up merchandiser
I want the new columns of the Status Overview tab to be included in the excel file created by the "Export to Excel" function
So that I can create my own filters and reports based on the different order statuses
HistoryItems.ToValue:
As an order follow up merchandiser
I want the new columns of the Status Overview tab to be included in the excel file created by the "Export to Excel" function
So that I can create my own filters and reports based on the different order statuses

*Scenario 1: Show the "Export to Excel" button on the Status Overview tab*
Given that the user is logged in 
When the user opens/views the "Status Overview" tab
Then the "Export to Excel" button is shown to the right above the list
AND the button "Group by product" is NOT shown (i.e. remove this button from the Status Overview tab).
See the attached image

*Scenario 2: Show the "Export to Excel" button on the Order list tab (AS IS)* 
Given that the user is logged in 
When the user opens/views the "Order List" tab
Then the "Export to Excel" button is shown to the right of the "Group by product"/"View as List" button/link above the list (AS IS)

*Scenario 3: Export 7 additional columns to Excel*
Given Scenario 1 or 2
When the user clicks on the "Export to Excel" button/link
Then the following 7 columns are added to the right of the columns originally exported to Excel;
"OPD", "PU", "Composition", "Order Package", "C/S Status", "L/S Status", "P/S Status".

fields.Summary: Re-filtering page leaves you on same "page number" as previously - should go to first page

HistoryItems.FromValue:
The error message ("All articles on the order have been cancelled" displayed in SCSC when trying to Secure an order is not correct. The order cannot be secured due to the fact that we need data from the OrderedProductSpecification table not because all articles are cancelled. Please see attached picture. 

If it's not possible to secure an order in SCSC due to the fact that the import of  OrderedProductSpecification is not working the error message should say:
Ordered Option data is not available at the moment.

HistoryItems.ToValue:
As a SCSC user I should not be able to secure an order if order product specification is out of sync with order.

Scenario 1: Can secure
*GIVEN* order product specification and order data is in sync for order 12345
*WHEN* user "bob" opens SCSC
*THEN* the secure button should be enabled

Scenario 2: Can not secure
*GIVEN* order product specification and order data is out of sync for order 12345
*WHEN* user "bob" opens SCSC
*THEN* the secure button should be disabled
 *AND* an error message should be displayed saying Order option data is not available at the moment

*Business rules for if order product specification and order data is in sync:*
All articles related to options should be available on the order.
Scenario 3:
*GIVEN* an order 12345
*GIVEN* order 12345 has an ordered product specification OPS1
*GIVEN* There is an article ARTICLE123 on OPS1
*GIVEN* ARTICLE123 is not present on order 12345
*THEN* OPS1 and order 12345 are out of sync

*WHEN* user "bob" opens SCSC
*THEN* the secure button should be disabled
 *AND* an error message should be displayed saying Order option data is not available at the moment

All articles related to options should be available on the order.

HistoryItems.FromValue:
As a SCSC user I should not be able to secure an order if order product specification is out of sync with order.

*Scenario 1: Can secure*
GIVEN order product specification and order data is in sync for order 12345
WHEN user "bob" opens SCSC
THEN the secure button should be enabled

*Scenario 2: Can not secure*
GIVEN order product specification and order data is out of sync for order 12345
WHEN user "bob" opens SCSC
THEN the secure button should be disabled
 AND an error message should be displayed saying Order option data is not available at the moment

*Business rules for if order product specification and order data is in sync:*
All articles related to options should be available on the order.
*Scenario 3:*
GIVEN an order 12345
GIVEN order 12345 has an ordered product specification OPS1
GIVEN There is an article ARTICLE123 on OPS1
GIVEN ARTICLE123 is not present on order 12345
WHEN checking if OPS1 and order 12345 are in sync

HistoryItems.ToValue:
As a SCSC user I should not be able to secure an order if order product specification is out of sync with order.

Scenario 1: Article on ordered product specification option is missing on order
GIVEN an order 12345
GIVEN order 12345 has an ordered product specification OPS1
GIVEN There is an article ARTICLE123 on OPS1
GIVEN ARTICLE123 is not present on order 12345
WHEN importing order 12345
THEN OrderedProductSpecificationInSync is set to false

Scenario 2: All articles related to ordered product specification option are available on the order
GIVEN an order 12345
GIVEN order 12345 has an ordered product specification OPS1
GIVEN all articles on all options on OPS1 are available on order 12345
WHEN importing OPS1
THEN OrderedProductSpecificationInSync is set to true

*Scenario 3: Can secure*
GIVEN order product specification and order data is in sync for order 12345
WHEN user "bob" opens SCSC
THEN the secure button should be enabled

*Scenario 4: Can not secure*
GIVEN order product specification and order data is out of sync for order 12345
WHEN user "bob" opens SCSC
THEN the secure button should be disabled
 AND an error message should be displayed saying Order option data is not available at the moment
